title: All is ours and our husbands, or The country hostesses vindication. She durst not scold 'tis counted for an evil. Sheel cheat and whore, and yet be counted civil; sheel fill her pocketsby [sic] poor drunkards losses, and send then all to jayl by weeping crosses. To the tune, of the Carmans VVhistle, or High boys up go we.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Pye-Corner,
